title: Amanda Holden returns with her broken leg on a scooter (and heels!) as she makes glam arrival
text:

Amanda Holden returned to work with her broken leg on a scooter.

Yet the Britain's Got Talent judge, 48, still looked as glamorous as ever in a scarlet PVC skirt when she arrived at the office, in London on Monday.

Despite having broken her leg in two places, Amanda sported one red heel to complement her racy ensemble.

The blonde bombshell rested her broken leg on the scooter while she wheeled herself down the corridor.

Amanda posed up a storm for a picture and a stylish video.

She wrote in the caption: " #morning @thisisheart #breakfast great to be back ♥️." (sic)

Heart Radio also celebrated her return on their social media account with a clip of Amanda scooting down the hallway.

(Image: Instagram)

The post read: "Because she's worth it. Amanda Holden is back!"

The Britain's Got Talent judge required an emergency operation on holiday when she broke her leg in two places.

Amanda suffered the unfortunate accident while she was tackling a Total Wipeout-style inflatable assault course.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

The Heart FM breakfast show co-host was said to have snapped her fibula in two places while playing with her seven-year-old daughter Hollie.

The TV star was rushed to hospital by her record producer husband Chris Hughes where she had a metal plate fitted into leg.

Despite having her leg in plaster following the nasty accident and being on crutches, Amanda has vowed to be back at work on Monday to join Jamie Theakston on Heart FM's breakfast show.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

She explained: "So basically I was trying to be a good mother Jamie and I put my book down, I put down the Uno cards… and I said to Hollie ‘Mummy can come on that with you’ and there’s this like, you remember [Total] Wipeout, that TV thing?

"There’s like a children’s Total Wipeout thing in the middle of the sea and … mistily get round it and I thought yeah I can do that, so Hollie was doing brilliantly and going round it.

She went on: "I walked around it and then crawled across like an old person, like across the difficult bits. And then there were these three inflatable stepping stones in the middle of the sea and everyone else was running across it and I thought ‘oh I could do that, if kids can do it I can do it’ and I did it and I made it.

"I was showing off Jamie – I made it across to the other side and then my leg slipped coz obviously its wet, like an inflatable thing in the sea, my leg slipped and it went the other way and I felt it break and I fell in to the sea and I had to swim back to the shore one legged."

"I’ve broken it in two places, I’ve broken my fibula in two places and I was rushed to hospital and I’ve got a metal plate and screws in my leg which currently is the fastest and easiest way for it to heal. I haven’t got a cast I’ve got like metal in my leg and a splint and it’s all wrapped up and it’s got a heartbeat in it."
description: Amanda wasted no time getting back to work after she required an emergency operation for breaking her leg
